     [java] java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.update.core.Category incompatible with org.eclipse.update.core.model.SiteModel

console log during one of the runs that produces class cast exception

I take back part of what I said ... I ran again and saw only one one site, for two feautures ... VE site, or its two features, JEM and VE. I dont' see anything funny with this file, right off .... ? 

http:/download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/updates/1.0/site.xml

I need to make this "blocker" since I've tried 1.4 JRE (as well as 1.5) and Rich has updated this features and site.xml file to try and make them "just like all the others". I've tried using RC4, RC3, and RC2 of base platform update function ... and that's worked in previous weeks ... 

So ... any suggestions? I'm stumped. Below is the command I use ... if you want to give it a try. 


-application org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -command mirror -featureId org.eclipse.ve -version 1.2.0.v20060518_RC1 -from file:///home/data/users/david_williams/downloads/tools/ve/updates/1.0/development/site.xml -to /home/data/users/david_williams/downloads/callisto/staging -ignoreMissingPlugins true
     [java] Command-line arguments:  -clean -application org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -data /home/data/users/david_williams/org.eclipse.callisto.tools/build-home/buildworkspace -debug -consolelog -command mirror -featureId org.eclipse.ve -version 1.2.0.v20060518_RC1 -from file:///home/data/users/david_williams/downloads/tools/ve/updates/1.0/development/site.xml -to /home/data/users/david_williams/downloads/callisto/staging -ignoreMissingPlugins true

I just visited http:/download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/updates/1.0/site.xml from UM ui for a quick test and it had no problem parsing it. This is strange since stack trace says it happens in site.xml parser and i should get exception here too. I will try using mirror command later.

Sorry, I pasted wrong URL in comment #2 .. the one that has the new features is at 

http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/updates/1.0/development/site.xml

(and I just tried from "update manager" and got same class cast error.
David, one of the category-def elements in site.xml does not have closing tag.
I just fixed it. Something broke in the site.xml publish program and it grabbed some lines incorrectly when it updated it.

Thanks everyone ... that'll teach me to not use Eclipse to look at XML files. :) 

I did open bug 142833 just as a reminder this sort of thing can be improved in the future (to at least give a more meaningful error message).
I made the change and David verified that it worked.
VE 1.2RC1 is out, so these can now be closed.
